speaker: LAFEW
text: No, no, no, your son was misled with a

speaker: LAFEW
text: snipped-taffeta fellow there, whose villainous saffron

speaker: LAFEW
text: would have made all the unbaked and doughy

speaker: LAFEW
text: youth of a nation in his color. Your daughter-in-law

speaker: LAFEW
text: had been alive at this hour, and your son here

speaker: LAFEW
text: at home, more advanced by the King than by that

speaker: LAFEW
text: red-tailed humble-bee I speak of.

speaker: COUNTESS
text: I would I had not known him. It was the

speaker: COUNTESS
text: death of the most virtuous gentlewoman that ever

speaker: COUNTESS
text: nature had praise for creating. If she had partaken

speaker: COUNTESS
text: of my flesh and cost me the dearest groans of a

speaker: COUNTESS
text: mother, I could not have owed her a more rooted

speaker: COUNTESS
text: love.

speaker: LAFEW
text: ’Twas a good lady, ’twas a good lady. We may

speaker: LAFEW
text: pick a thousand salads ere we light on such another

speaker: LAFEW
text: herb.

speaker: FOOL
text: Indeed, sir, she was the sweet marjoram of the

speaker: FOOL
text: salad, or rather the herb of grace.

speaker: LAFEW
text: They are not herbs, you knave. They are

speaker: LAFEW
text: nose-herbs.

speaker: FOOL
text: I am no great Nebuchadnezzar, sir. I have not

speaker: FOOL
text: much skill in grass.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Whether dost thou profess thyself, a knave or a

speaker: LAFEW
text: fool?

speaker: FOOL
text: A fool, sir, at a woman’s service, and a knave at a

speaker: FOOL
text: man’s.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Your distinction?

speaker: FOOL
text: I would cozen the man of his wife and do his

speaker: FOOL
text: service.

speaker: LAFEW
text: So you were a knave at his service indeed.

speaker: FOOL
text: And I would give his wife my bauble, sir, to do

speaker: FOOL
text: her service.

speaker: LAFEW
text: I will subscribe for thee, thou art both knave

speaker: LAFEW
text: and fool.

speaker: FOOL
text: At your service.

speaker: LAFEW
text: No, no, no.

speaker: FOOL
text: Why, sir, if I cannot serve you, I can serve as

speaker: FOOL
text: great a prince as you are.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Who’s that, a Frenchman?

speaker: FOOL
text: Faith, sir, he has an English name, but his

speaker: FOOL
text: phys’nomy is more hotter in France than there.

speaker: LAFEW
text: What prince is that?

speaker: FOOL
text: The black prince, sir, alias the prince of darkness,

speaker: FOOL
text: alias the devil.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Hold thee, there’s my

speaker: LAFEW
text: purse. I give thee not this to suggest thee from thy

speaker: LAFEW
text: master thou talk’st of. Serve him still.

speaker: FOOL
text: I am a woodland fellow, sir, that always loved a

speaker: FOOL
text: great fire, and the master I speak of ever keeps a

speaker: FOOL
text: good fire. But sure he is the prince of the world; let

speaker: FOOL
text: his Nobility remain in ’s court. I am for the house

speaker: FOOL
text: with the narrow gate, which I take to be too little

speaker: FOOL
text: for pomp to enter. Some that humble themselves

speaker: FOOL
text: may, but the many will be too chill and tender, and

speaker: FOOL
text: they’ll be for the flow’ry way that leads to the

speaker: FOOL
text: broad gate and the great fire.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Go thy ways. I begin to be aweary of thee. And

speaker: LAFEW
text: I tell thee so before because I would not fall out

speaker: LAFEW
text: with thee. Go thy ways. Let my horses be well

speaker: LAFEW
text: looked to, without any tricks.

speaker: FOOL
text: If I put any tricks upon ’em, sir, they shall be

speaker: FOOL
text: jades’ tricks, which are their own right by the law

speaker: FOOL
text: of nature.

speaker: LAFEW
text: A shrewd knave and an unhappy.

speaker: COUNTESS
text: So he is. My lord that’s gone made himself

speaker: COUNTESS
text: much sport out of him. By his authority he

speaker: COUNTESS
text: remains here, which he thinks is a patent for his

speaker: COUNTESS
text: sauciness, and indeed he has no pace, but runs

speaker: COUNTESS
text: where he will.

speaker: LAFEW
text: I like him well. ’Tis not amiss. And I was about

speaker: LAFEW
text: to tell you, since I heard of the good lady’s death

speaker: LAFEW
text: and that my lord your son was upon his return

speaker: LAFEW
text: home, I moved the King my master to speak in the

speaker: LAFEW
text: behalf of my daughter, which in the minority of

speaker: LAFEW
text: them both his Majesty out of a self-gracious

speaker: LAFEW
text: remembrance did first propose. His Highness hath

speaker: LAFEW
text: promised me to do it, and to stop up the displeasure

speaker: LAFEW
text: he hath conceived against your son there is

speaker: LAFEW
text: no fitter matter. How does your Ladyship like it?

speaker: COUNTESS
text: With very much content, my lord, and I

speaker: COUNTESS
text: wish it happily effected.

speaker: LAFEW
text: His Highness comes post from Marseilles, of

speaker: LAFEW
text: as able body as when he numbered thirty. He will

speaker: LAFEW
text: be here tomorrow, or I am deceived by him that in

speaker: LAFEW
text: such intelligence hath seldom failed.

speaker: COUNTESS
text: It rejoices me that, I hope, I shall see him

speaker: COUNTESS
text: ere I die. I have letters that my son will be here

speaker: COUNTESS
text: tonight. I shall beseech your Lordship to remain

speaker: COUNTESS
text: with me till they meet together.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Madam, I was thinking with what manners I

speaker: LAFEW
text: might safely be admitted.

speaker: COUNTESS
text: You need but plead your honorable

speaker: COUNTESS
text: privilege.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Lady, of that I have made a bold charter. But I

speaker: LAFEW
text: thank my God it holds yet.

speaker: FOOL
text: O madam, yonder’s my lord your son with a

speaker: FOOL
text: patch of velvet on ’s face. Whether there be a scar

speaker: FOOL
text: under ’t or no, the velvet knows, but ’tis a goodly

speaker: FOOL
text: patch of velvet. His left cheek is a cheek of two pile

speaker: FOOL
text: and a half, but his right cheek is worn bare.

speaker: LAFEW
text: A scar nobly got, or a noble scar, is a good liv’ry

speaker: LAFEW
text: of honor. So belike is that.

speaker: FOOL
text: But it is your carbonadoed face.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Let us go see your son, I pray you. I long to talk

speaker: LAFEW
text: with the young noble soldier.

speaker: FOOL
text: ’Faith, there’s a dozen of ’em, with delicate fine

speaker: FOOL
text: hats, and most courteous feathers which bow the

speaker: FOOL
text: head and nod at every man.
